title: Fried red mullet with oranges and capers
description: The red mullet off Monemvasia are supposedly the best in the Aegean. A net full of them, red yes, but pink too with flashes of yellow as the sun rose on a still dark blue sea is a lovely recollection, and fried for breakfast later they were quite memorable. A month later though, I saw three autumn mullet in our fish shop and I cooked them simply with a dusting of semolina. I used to think the Mediterranean mullet were better than ours, but now I know the ones that come to Cornwall in autumn are pretty hard to beat.
ingredients: 8 small or 4 medium red mullet, scaled and gutted
2 small oranges; 1 zested and juiced, 1 thinly sliced into rounds
small handful flatleaf parsley, roughly chopped
